issue_1.title: Color Superposition States
issue_1.original: A quark is definitively red, green, OR blue—not a continuous superposition
issue_1.corrected: Color quantum numbers are discrete {R, G, B}, but quarks in hadrons exist in quantum superpositions. Only color-singlet combinations are observable asymptotically.

issue_2.title: Affine Independence Theorem
issue_2.original: N distinguishable points require D >= N-1
issue_2.corrected: N affinely independent points (forming an (N-1)-simplex) require exactly N-1 dimensions. This is stronger than mere distinguishability.
issue_2.mathematics: Affine independence ≠ distinguishability. Counter-example: 100 points on a line are distinguishable in D=1.

issue_3.title: Framework Scope
issue_3.corrected: Framework-specific geometric realization constraint. Standard QFT allows any SU(N) in any D >= 4.
issue_3.example: SU(5) GUT is mathematically consistent in D=4, excluded by experiment not dimension.
